identificationModule.briefTitle: Pemetrexed/Carboplatin Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) Elderly Patients
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase II Trial Pemetrexed Carboplatin as First Line Chemotherapy for Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC) in Elderly Patients

descriptionModule.briefSummary: A phase II study to evaluate the efficacy and safety profile of the combination of Pemetrexed and Carboplatin in elderly patients with advanced non-small cell lung cancer

armGroups.label: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
armGroups.description:
Pemetrexed: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m\^2), intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles.

Carboplatin: Area Under the Curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles.

interventions.name: pemetrexed
interventions.description: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m\^2), intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

interventions.name: carboplatin
interventions.description: Area Under the Curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles

primaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Complete or Partial Tumor Response (Overall Tumor Response)
primaryOutcomes.description: Tumor response is defined as the percentage of patients with either a complete response or a partial response. Response was determined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions and Partial Response=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline to measured objective tumor response (up to six 21-day cycles)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Defined as the time from study enrollment to the first observation of disease progression, death as a result of any cause, or early discontinuation of treatment. Time to treatment failure was censored at the date of the last follow-up visit for patients who did not discontinue early, who were still alive, and who have not progressed.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline to stopping treatment (up to six 21-day cycles)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Overall survival is the duration from enrollment to death. For patients who are alive, overall survival is censored at the last contact.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline to date of death from any cause (up to 14.5 months)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Estimated Probability of One Year Progression-free Survival
secondaryOutcomes.description: Progression free survival (PFS) is the duration from enrollment until first disease progression or death. For patients not known to have died as of the data cut-off date and who do not have progressive disease, PFS is censored at the last radiological assessment date.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline to measured progressive disease or death, 1 year

otherOutcomes.description: Defined as the time from study enrollment to the first observation of disease progression, death as a result of any cause, or early discontinuation of treatment. Time to treatment failure was censored at the date of the last follow-up visit for patients who did not discontinue early, who were still alive, and who have not progressed.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: baseline to stopping treatment (up to six 21-day cycles)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Pathologically confirmed Non Small Cell Lung Cancer Stage IIIb (not amenable to radiotherapy treatment) or Stage IV
* No previous chemotherapy for lung cancer
* Men and women \> or = 70 years
* At least one uni-dimensionally measurable lesion (Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors \[RECIST\]criteria)
* Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status 0 to 1

Exclusion Criteria:

* Treatment within the last 30 days with a drug that has not received regulatory approval
* Serious systemic disorders
* Inability to discontinue administration of aspirin or anti-inflammatory non steroid
* Concurrent administration of any other antitumor therapy
* Brain metastasis

measures.title: Disease Stage
measures.description: Stage means how big the tumor is and how far it has spread. Stages range from 0 (not spread) to IV (spread throughout the body).

measures.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status
measures.description: Classifies patients according to their functional impairment. Scores range from 0 (Fully Active) to 5 (Death).

classes.title: Other: Indifferencied Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Participants With a Complete or Partial Tumor Response (Overall Tumor Response)
outcomeMeasures.description: Tumor response is defined as the percentage of patients with either a complete response or a partial response. Response was determined using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Complete Response=disappearance of all target lesions and Partial Response=30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Patients qualified for tumor response analysis: treated patients, with measurable advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) disease and at least one tumor assessment after the patient received at least a first cycle of chemotherapy (unless early progression occurs, including early clinical progressions confirmed by the assessment committee).
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: baseline to measured objective tumor response (up to six 21-day cycles)

groups.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
groups.description:
Pemetrexed: 500 milligrams per square meter (mg/m\^2), intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles.

Carboplatin: Area Under the Curve (AUC) 5, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles.

outcomeMeasures.title: Time to Treatment Failure
outcomeMeasures.description: Defined as the time from study enrollment to the first observation of disease progression, death as a result of any cause, or early discontinuation of treatment. Time to treatment failure was censored at the date of the last follow-up visit for patients who did not discontinue early, who were still alive, and who have not progressed.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: All treated patients. 29 patients were censored.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: baseline to stopping treatment (up to six 21-day cycles)

measurements.comment: Confidence interval is not calculable for the upper limit due to the immaturity of the data.

outcomeMeasures.title: Overall Survival
outcomeMeasures.description: Overall survival is the duration from enrollment to death. For patients who are alive, overall survival is censored at the last contact.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Twenty patients were censored as they were still alive at the time of the data cut-off.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: baseline to date of death from any cause (up to 14.5 months)

outcomeMeasures.title: Estimated Probability of One Year Progression-free Survival
outcomeMeasures.description: Progression free survival (PFS) is the duration from enrollment until first disease progression or death. For patients not known to have died as of the data cut-off date and who do not have progressive disease, PFS is censored at the last radiological assessment date.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Six patients were censored as they had not experienced a qualifying event (death or first disease progression) at the time of data cut-off.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: baseline to measured progressive disease or death, 1 year
